results.title: Amazing ants
results.brief_description: Explores life in an ant colony. Shows ants fending for and protecting themselves and milking a herd of aphids. Also reveals the intricate tunnels of an underground nest, food storage and the care of young larvae and pupae.
results.description: Explores life in an ant colony. Shows ants fending for and protecting themselves and milking a herd of aphids. Also reveals the intricate tunnels of an underground nest, food storage and the care of young larvae and pupae.

results.title: Kanga Cricket
results.brief_description: An Australian Cricket Board primary development programme for kids, sponsored by the Australian Diary Corporation and supported by the Commonwealth Department of Sport, Recreation and Tourism. Demonstrates the concept of Kanga cricket, a simplified adaptation of traditional cricket rules introduced into Australian schools. Former Australian cricket captain Kim Hughes and Peter Russell-Clarke participate.

results.title: Participation and equity program
results.brief_description: Outlines the philosophy behind the Participation and Equity Program and provides an overview of the ways in which some schools throughout Australia are implementing programs that are attempting to come to terms with overcoming barriers to effective participation by students in education. Changes in curriculum, school research community groups, and the teaching of English as a second language are just some of the methods outlined. No other credits.

results.title: The Voyage of the Pacific peacemaker
results.brief_description: An intriguing look at a group of people who set out from Australia to sail first of all to Muroroa Atoll in the Pacific and then to the west coast of the USA to protest against the French tests in the Pacific and the deployment of the Trident nuclear submarines. Raises issues about the effectiveness of such protests, the motivations of the people involved and the differences of opinion of the people in the group. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Our food
results.brief_description: Traces the sources and processing of many familiar foods. Shows both the old fashioned and modern ways of raising wheat, making bread, milking cows and separating cream. Includes visits to a spaghetti factory, chicken and egg farm, a dairy, a cheese factory, a potato field, an apple orchard, a fishing trawler, a meat processing plant and a sausage shop. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Aussie assault
results.creator_credit: Harvey Spencer, Bill Scholer, Garry Holt and Sportmaster Programs
results.brief_description: A behind-the-scenes look at the work and preparation that went into Australia II winning entry in the America’s Cup. Shows the crew at leisure as well as at work.

results.title: Safety in ceramics
results.creator_credit: K Starbuck and Moorabbin College of TAFE
results.brief_description: Introduces basic safety precautions for a ceramic studio when using clay as a creative medium in the classroom. Addresses safety and health hazards inherent in clay dust, the kiln, glazes, electricity and tools.

results.title: Jana and the crowing hen
results.brief_description: Jana goes to stay with her grandparents on their farm when her mother becomes ill. Jana is suprised to find that her grandmother goes out to work while her grandfather stays at home. Useful in promoting discussions about sex-roles and stereotyping. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: If you know how I feel: Scott's old new friend
results.creator_credit: Linda Haskins and Centron Educational Films
results.brief_description: Tells the story of 10-year-old Scott who befriends an old woman in a park. The value of their friendship is revealed as Scott obtains books for the woman and she helps him to improve his reading. A sympathetic portrayal of old age that will help in breaking down stereotypes and promoting discussion about values and self-determination. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
